Mahabaleshwar – For A Divine Vacation Pleasure Located 120 kilometers from Pune, the city of Mahabaleshwar is counted among the best hill stations near Pune Maharashtra. It gives you the divine pleasure of vacation amidst the abundant nature, evergreen beauty, and captivating hills. The scenic hilly region presents enchanting hilltop views and some beautiful temples to explore, led by a comfortable climatic condition. Spend your time watching birds, exploring temples, and hiking to the mountain ranges. Lavasa – A Scenic Town Aesthetics are not only restricted to your Instagram filters because this quaint city of Maharashtra, has got some of it too. The scenic town is the nearest hill station from Pune, located just 58 kilometers away. The hill station offers a collection of bright color-coordinated buildings amidst the serene lakes and enchanting nature. It is one of the most hyped hill stations near Pune in summer due to the ample outdoor activity; it has to offer. Go for some jet skiing, pedal boating, luxury cruising to feel the adrenaline rush. Distance from Pune: 60 Km Best time to visit Lavasa: June to September Ideal for: Photographers, Bloggers, Solo Travellers, Adventurers, Groups Ideal trip duration: 2 days Must-visit places in Lavasa: Lakeside Promenade, Bamboosa, Temghar Dam How to reach from the airport: Bus, Car Suggested Read: Lavasa In November: Escape To This Paradise And Enjoy A Relaxing Time! 3. Panchgani – Lots Of Enchanting Valleys Located about 102 kilometers away from Pune, Panchgani boasts the picturesque hills and enchanting valleys wrapped in the lush green nature. It features several vantage points, teeming with evergreen panoramic vistas. Being one of the beautiful hill stations near pune, it offers excellent scope to witness the charm of the mountains and delve into the serene nature. The scenic view of the mountains during the rainy season is an unusual sight to catch. Upon reaching, do not leave the chance to indulge in paragliding and boating. Distance from Pune: 103 Km Best time to visit Panchgani: September to May Ideal for: Groups, friends, couples Ideal trip duration: 3 days Must-visit places in Panchgani: Parsi Point, Devils Kitchen, Table Land, Sydney Point, Devrai Art Village How to reach from the airport: Bus, Private Cars Suggested Read: 10 Restaurants In Panchgani That Serve A Piece Of Heaven On Your Plate 4. Bhandardara – Pleasant Climate The mesmerizing hamlet town, located 172 kilometers from Pune, offers an enchanting view of the Western Ghats to the tourists. It is one of the sought after hill stations near Pune for honeymoon couples due to the presence of several cascading waterfalls, lush green nature, tranquil ambiance, serene mountains, and pleasant climate. Being the home to Kalsubai, it serves as a hub for mountain trekkers and hikers from all over the world. You can also indulge in some exciting camping through the rugged terrains. Distance from Pune: 172 Km Best time to visit Bhandardara: August to December Ideal for: Couples, Solo Travellers, Family Ideal trip duration: 2 days Must-visit places in Bhandardara: Umbrella Fall Bhandardara, Kalsubai, Arthur Hill Lake, Amruteshwar Temple, Wilson Dam How to reach from the airport: Rail, Road Suggested Read: 25 Beautiful Beaches Near Pune For A Perfect Weekend Escape! Igatpuri – Quench Your Wanderlust For all the adventure seekers out there, Igatpuri, 248 kilometers from Pune, serves as the sheer retreat. It is replete with some enthralling hilly terrains, led by some action-packed activities. If you are looking for some hill stations near Pune in winter, then quench your thirst with a visit to the magical realm of Igatpuri. You can get in here for some exciting camping with your friends, explore the ancient Hindu temples, and attempt a trek through the steep Kalsubai Peak. Distance from Pune: 240 Km Best time to visit Igatpuri: November to March Ideal for: Trekkers, Nature lovers, Couples, Pilgrims, Senior Citizens Ideal trip duration: 2 days Must-visit places in igatpuri: Dhamma Giri Vipassana International Academy, Vihigaon Falls, Ghatandevi Mata Temple, Thal Ghat, Bhavali Dam, Taked Tirth Hindu pilgrimage Temple How to reach from the airport: Rail, Bus, Cars Suggested Read: 32 Romantic Places In Pune And Around To Visit With Your Partner 6. Lonavala – A Green Blanket Lonavala, just 65 km away is another nearest hill station from Pune. If your eyes have almost become stoned to the views of the urban cityscape, then the green blanket will surely soothe them. Located at proximity, Lonavala is one of the best hill stations near Pune within 100 km. It boasts of scenic nature, crowned with enchanting waterfalls, dense timber lands, and paradisaical valleys. Apart from it, you can find the traditional sweet, ‘Chikki,’ to munch on, not to forget the best-known fresh groundnuts and jaggery. Distance from Pune: 65 Km Best time to visit Lonavala: October to May Ideal for: Friends, Adventurers, Couples Ideal trip duration: 3 days Must-visit places in Lonavala: Lonavala Lake, Kune Falls, Kune Falls, Bushi Dam, Ryewood Park How to reach from the airport: Bus, Car Suggested Read: 20 Finest Places To Visit In Lonavala In Rainy Season 7. Khandala – An Ultimate Destination If you are already humming the evergreen Bollywood song “Aati Kya Khandala,” then you’re right? This is the place where the song refers to, and just so you know, every lyric of the song saying about the destination does justice to it in reality and you just might understand why this is the ultimate hill stations near Pune for honeymoon. Nestled in the foothills of the Sahyadri Ranges, Khandala features some picturesque lake views, gushing waterfalls, and green stretch of valleys. Due to its proximity to Pune, only 71 kilometers, Khandala has become a tourist hotspot for many past years. If you happen to hop on during the chilly winters, you can capture the mesmerizing view of the snow-capped mountains. Khandala is, in fact, one of the best honeymoon places near Pune. Distance from Pune: 70 Km Best time to visit Khandala: July to September Ideal for: Adventurers, Couples, Friends, Groups Ideal trip duration: 3 days Must-visit places in Khandala: Sunil’s Celebrity Wax Museum, Shingroba temple, Lion’s point Lonavala How to reach from the airport: Car Suggested Read: 16 Best Things To Do In Khandala For An Unforgettable Experience! 8. Rajmachi – A Photographer’s Paradise The particular hill resort, 172 kilometers away from Pune, features the historical past of Maharashtra and narrates it through its beauty. The iconic hill station serves as the home to two ancient forts namely, Manaranjan Balekilla and Shrivardhan Balekilla and is one of the historical and beautiful hill stations around Pune. It is a great tourist destination for trekkers out there because the distance from the base of the hill to the fort can be accessed through trekking. The route makes it one of  the best trekking destinations near Mumbai and Pune. If you happen to be a photographer and want to make your adventures memorable for a lifetime, then the enchanting view around will surely captivate you. Distance from Pune: 173 Km Best time to visit Rajmachi: June to September Ideal for: Solo travelers, Photographers, Hikers Ideal trip duration: 2 days Must-visit places in Rajmachi: Shrivardhan Fort, Pritisangam KARAD, Krishna Koyna Pritisangam, Naktya Rawlyachi Vihir, Krishnamai Mandir How to reach from the airport: Taxi, Car Suggested Read: 8 Insanely Gorgeous Destinations Near Pune That Managed To Remain Hidden Till Now! 9. Karjat – Untouched Natural Beauty The untouched beauty of nature relaxes your senses, ideally, from the hectic daily schedules of urban life. Being located 180 kilometers away from the city of Pune, Karjat is not quite famous among significant tourists yet but that won’t keep us from recommending it and saying it is one of the most gorgeous hill stations near Pune Maharashtra. The vast stretch of abundant greenery, highlighted by the cold climatic conditions and ample adventure opportunities, can serve as the picture-perfect holiday destination to plan next. If you end up hopping here with your family and friends, then do not leave a scope behind to enjoy the picnic and adrenaline rush river rafting. Distance from Pune: 100 Km Best time to visit Karjat: March to June Ideal for: Family, Kids, Couples Ideal trip duration: 3 days Must-visit places in Karjat: Irshalgad, Morbe Dam, Sondai Fort, Mahalakshmi Temple, Bhimgad Fort How to reach from the airport: Private taxi, bus Suggested Read: 20 Most Romantic Restaurants In Pune For An Idyllic Dinner Date 10. Malshej Ghat – Trek High Above Nature lovers tend to go Ga-Ga over this place, located 138 kilometers from Pune. One of the best hill stations near Pune in winter, Malshej Ghat is well-blended with the natural wonders of the place, which includes scenic sky-high waterfalls, elevated slopes, and enchanting locations. Especially during the winters, the Harishchandragad area is quite famous among the trekkers due to its beautiful trekking trails and steep slope regions. Upon visit, enjoy watching the birds by the huge dams, and doing some thrilling activities, without partaking any risks. Distance from Pune: 120 Km Best time to visit Malshej Ghat: June to September Ideal for: Trekkers, Family, Groups Ideal trip duration: 2 days Must-visit places in Malshej Ghat: Pimpalgaon Joga Dam, Harishchandragad Fort, Ajoba Hill Fort, Pushpavati river, Darkoba Peak How to reach from the airport: Rail, Cab Suggested Read: Bungee Jumping Near Pune: A Handy Guide To Experience This Enthralling Activity! 11. Matheran – Enjoy Nature’s Breath Matheran is typically a small hill station near Pune where you can enjoy the breath of nature with several points, lakes and forests. It is an eco-tourism site and a perfect weekend getaway, especially if you are living in Pune or a Mumbaikaar. Stay at one of the best cottages or villas in Matheran, which are cost-effective and offer breathtaking views of your surroundings. What’s great about Matheran is that it is the only automobile-free hill station in Asia. Best time to visit Matheran: All year round Ideal for: Picnics, Family, Friends Ideal trip duration: 3 days Must-visit places in Matheran: Garbett Point, Alexander Point, Charlotte Lake, Porcupine Point, Echo Point, Shivaji’s Ladder, Vikatgad Peb Fort How to reach from the airport: Rail, Cab Suggested Read: 9 Best Places To Visit In Pune In Summer For A Cool Vacation 12. Panhala – For Hill Station Stories Panhala is a very small hill station and a municipal council, growing at a rapid pace. It is a hill station full of haunting and daunting stories. So, it therefore, becomes a unique destination attracting weekenders, tourists as well as historians. The place is known to be the capital of the Maratha empire with Chatrapati Shivaji spending a lot of time during his tenure. The stories of the empire were quite famous and you catch them by interacting with the lovely people of Panhala, especially the old ones. Stories, a cup of tea and hill station – sounds too good? Well, that’s because it is! Distance from Pune: 238 Km Best time to visit Panhala: October to May Ideal for: Historians, Friends, Families Couples Ideal trip duration: 2 days Must-visit places in Panhala: Parashar Caves, Panhala Fort How to reach from the airport: Cabs, Private Cars Suggested Read: 7 Best Cottages In Pune That Reeks Of Coziness From Every Nook! 13. Jawhar – A Picturesque Setting  There can be no better hill stations around Pune than the beautiful place called Jawhar. Capturing a picturesque setting with a vibrant cultural heritage, Jawhar lies at the core Western Ghats region. It is one of the only remaining tribal regions around Pune where you can admire the famous Warli paintings. Due to its pristine nature, Jawhar is a favorite destination for couples as well. Why would you not love a place housing ancient tales and has managed to stay away from the usual hustle-bustle! Distance from Pune: 240 Km Best time to visit Jawahar: July to September Ideal for: Couples, Historians, Friends Ideal trip duration: 3 days Must-visit places in Jawahar: Kal Mandavi Waterfalls,  Jai Sagar Dam, Hanuman Point, Sunset Point, Jaivilas Palace How to reach from the airport: Bus, Rail, Cabs Suggested Read: 7 Temples In Pune To Seek Blessings & Experience The Divine Form 14. Amboli – For An Exotic Flora And Fauna Amboli stands as one of the top notch hill stations around Pune housing an exotic range of unusual flora and fauna. Lying at the famous Sahyadri Hills of Western Ghats, Amboli is, indeed, a hub for camping, hiking and fishing at the Hiranyakeshi river flowing through. Another ecotourism site around Pune, you will get a full-scale rejuvenation at Amboli. A strange fact about Amboli is that there are around 108 Shiva temples in Amboli of which only 12 have been found. Is god’s glory awaiting? Visit Amboli to find out! Distance from Pune: 349 Km Best time to visit Amboli: October to February Ideal for: Friends, Families, Couples Ideal trip duration: 2-3 days Must-visit places in Amboli: Amboli Ghat Waterfall, Mahadev Gad, Shri Hiranyakeshwar Mandir, Shirgaonkar Point, Amboli Sunset Point, Amboli Forest Park, Nangartas Waterfalls How to reach from the airport: Cabs, Private Cars Suggested Read: 8 Fabulous Places To Visit In Pune In June For A Tranquil Vacay 15. Saputara – Welcome To Nature’s Womb Just on the outskirts of Maharashtra, lies the town of Saputara, one of the most popular hilly areas near Pune. Get ready to enter Nature’s Womb, the magnificent hill station welcomes you to the abode where you discover heaven on Earth. Crisscrossing the Ambika river, Saputara is a major hill station offering avenues for camping, bird watching, nature walks and lush sightseeing. You will be welcomed at multiple cottages, villas and homestays in Saputara that offer pretty cost-effective yet quality stays. So, go ahead and pack your bags! Best enjoyed if you are on a road trip, with several scenes lavishing your drive. Once done, you can easily re-route to Lavale, located 30 km from Tamhini Ghats. Frequently Asked Questions About Hill Stations Near Pune What is the condition of roads in these hill stations? Being hill stations, the roads are certainly not smooth enough to travel smoothly, but not majorly worse. Certain hilly terrains are not located at a high elevation and are thus not very steep. Nowadays, the authorities have become quite concerned regarding it, and are thus maintaining them quite well. You will frequently not come across many broken roads as of previous. Do I need to carry any legal documents for my trip to these hill stations? If you are someone coming from a place located outside India, then carrying legal documents like passports, visas, and identity proofs are a must. Moreover, many hotels and amusement places have different charges for the NRIs, which may pose to be a problem later. For the Indians, it is always safe to carry an identity proof along with you because inquiries can be made, and you cannot let it affect the experience of your trip. What is the budget to visit a hill station near Pune? As Pune is located within the country of India, it is not a high-cost affair for the people living in India, as there are several cheaper modes of transportation available. However, people coming from abroad need to spend a good deal of money on flight tickets and hotel costs. However, if you happen to book early, during the off-season, you may get some discounts. What type of foods are common in these hill stations? Usually, steamed foods are commonly found in the hill stations, due to their high altitude and elevation. Thus, you will get ample momos, thukpa, noodles to relish on. Apart from that, each place has some special local delicacies to serve, which is something worth exploring. What type of clothes should I pack? Hill stations near Pune hardly records the lowest temperatures near 15°C due to the coastal proximity. Even if the temperatures are low, it is not the lowest in these destinations. So, it is better to carry regular clothes at full length to fight the chilly breeze, sometimes. Other than that, as the Sun remains whole in the daytime, it is better to explore the places in some light-weight clothes. Do I need to hire a tour guide for sightseeing? If you are an avid traveler or a couple, then you would hardly want to hire a tour guide who would interrupt your privacy and freedom. But, if you are a group of travelers, family, or friends, then you can go for a tour guide, to know more about the place, and get the best out of it. Which are some of the nearest hill stations to Pune? Lonavala, Panchgani, Matheran, Khandala, and Bhandardara are some of the nearest hill stations to Pune. So, if a weekend getaway is on your mind from Pune, then do not think twice before planning a short trip to these scenic destinations. Which are some of the best hill stations to head during summers? Lavasa, Khandala, Lonavala, Mahabaleshwar, and Matheran are the best hill stations to visit during the pleasant summer vacation. Due to the location in the coastal region, these places do not experience humid summers, thus making the Sun quite friendly. Looking To Book An International Holiday?
